channel.title: Guitar choice
channel.description:
Ok, I need a new guitar, but I have no idea wich one is good. Here is a list of some I found and I want you guys to say wich one is best for me (I like metal, if that matters)
Ibanez SA 120 yamaha pacifica 112 Hondo II Les Paul 1974 Hondo 2 les paul custom Fernandes flying V Lag AM100
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

And what about the Jackson JS30RR? You think it’s a good one? Picture:

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

Get the Fernandes Flying V. It’s one of the most stylish guitars I’ve ever owned. I’ve gotten so many questions and compliments. Only problem is they’re a bitch to store, play, etc. And they’re very heavy at the bottom. so it slides down off your leg if you’re sitting down.

Being the noob i was with guitars my first guitar i bought was a bc rich “bronze warlock”
they look quite amazing but the fact was it was a bitch to play, you couldn’t even play while standing up because of where the strap was stuck to the guitar.

Just saying its better to get one that feels good to play than one that looks good.

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Get the Fernandes Flying V. It’s one of the most stylish guitars I’ve ever owned. I’ve gotten so many questions and compliments. Only problem is they’re a bitch to store, play, etc. And they’re very heavy at the bottom. so it slides down off your leg if you’re sitting down.

Or if you don’t mind buying one online, check ebay, you can get some good guitars there. I’ve got a couple replicas, and a couple rare legit ones. And they’re not that expensive. But if you absolutely must have one out of that list, I suggest the Flying V or Hondo II Les Paul 1974 if you want innovation. Or the Hondo2 Les Paul Custom for simplicity and beauty.

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

blah bah7:

dont go yamaha, their drums aren’t very good… (yes i know the topic is about guitars) go with something like fender

The Pacificas are fairly well-respected as a decent beginner-intermediate guitar, I’m not sure what that has to do with drums.

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

My fender is so rare I couldn’t even find a full picture of it on google.com

I found a few pictures, which look like it, it is a Fender Concert Tone:
http://1969fender.web.fc2.com/banjo.html

edit:
Finally found some pictures of my exact banjo:
http://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=ja&u=http://akohstic.com/shop2/list/Fender/Concerttone/Concerttone.html&sa=X&oi=translate&resnum=1&ct=result&prev=/search%3Fq%3Dfender%2Bconcerttone%26hl%3Den%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26rls%3Dcom.ubuntu:en-US:official%26sa%3DG

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:7, topic:140805”]Hmm, my guitar teacher also said that a yamaha pacifica was good, so I guess it’s going to be that one. But I’m still open to suggestions

Oh and a humbucker, is that any good or should I buy one without it?[/quote]

Get one with it, Pacificas are good to start with, I had a blue one, but once you get better, you find them to get shitty.

I have one of these:

http://www.guitarcenter.com/shop/product/Epiphone-SG-Standard-S.O.R-Electric-Guitar?full_sku=102676350

But if your not at that level, I recommend a Fender Strat, Mexican wood most likely.

Read full topic

@1337h4x wrote:

a guitar with strings is best imo

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Well, I think it’s going to be the yamaha pacifica. But I got another question about this. On some videos I see some metal things on the frets. Like this: |= fret V= what I mean |V|V|V|V|V|V| The question is a bit strange I know, but what I mean is that there is a little plate of metal between every fret.

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I would choose a Gibson SG. It’s what i personally use, and it’s the best guitar i’ve ever played

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

For an acoustic guitar (you didn’t specify) you just can’t beat a Martin or a Gibson. If you want an electric guitar (I assume), fender is the best, but yamaha and ibanez make good ones as well.

i’d say fenders are only good if your willing to spend alot of money, not sure in dollars but in english pounds its about £1000 for a good fender. Pretty sure you can get it cheaper.
But what i’m saying is that if you are only willing to spend about 600 dollars or so then you probably want to get an ibanez.

my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar choice
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I’m a guitar nub, but I’d recommend the Pacifica if your choice is out of those. POSSIBLY the Ibanez, although I’ve found with Ibanez you either love them or hate them - personally I don’t like them, but some people swear by everything they’ve ever made. Get yourself down to the music store and try the Pacifica and the Ibanez out, see which you prefer.

Read full topic
